page.description: Search for text after current offset, and replace it if found.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ReplaceString as l(search as c,replace as c)

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: True indicates that a replacement was made.

argument.name: search
argument.description: The text to find in the buffer.

page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.ReplaceString() function replaces the first instance of the Search_Text with Replace_Text. The offset is positioned immediately after Replace_Text.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is wonderful text written by a great writer %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.replacestring("wonderful","magnificent") = .T. ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is magnificent" ? scanner.GetRemainder() =prose written by a technical writer of note.
